artifact.content: Administrator can add new billing plans to System.
Administrator can edit existing billing plan in System.
Administrator can delete inactive billing plans from System.
Administrator can define/edit the regular rate of a billing plan.
Administrator can define/edit/delete one or more discount periods of a billing plan.
Administrator can define/edit the discount rate of a discount period of a billing plan.
System should monitor the event of a VoIP telephone being connected (plugged in).
System should monitor the event of a VoIP telephone being disconnected (unplugged).
System should translate the phone number dialed into the IP address and port number of the recipient of the call.
Administrator can change the billing period length and set an effective date for the new billing period.
Administrator can disable a connected, enabled phone.
Administrator can enable a disabled phone.
The system performs both administrator initiated connectivity test and scheduled periodic tests. This test polls each phone to see if it is still connected to the system.
Prints a bill for a specific user or a list of users.
If an error occurs on the phone or the user requests a reset, then administer resets the phone�s software.
The Administrator sets the maximum amount simultaneous phone calls that the system can support.
Administrator can add a new user account to System.
Administrator can edit existing user account in System.
Administrator can cancel a user account from System.
Administrator can login with a username and password and enter the Administration Console application.
Administrator can log out of the system and close the Admin Console application.
User is able to originate a VoIP call.
User is able to receive a VoIP call.
Operators enter bill payment to update account status
SuperAdmin can add an administrator account
SuperAdmin can edit an administrator account
SuperAdmin can delete an administrator account
When the user specified load balancing number is less than the amount of current phone connections the color of the current number of connections is highlighted with a distinctive color.
Administrator can view and print a specific bill of a specific user.
Administrator can view and print call history of a specific user for a specified period of time.
Administrator can suspend an active user account.
Administrator can reactivate a suspended user account.
Administrator must logon to the admin console to perform account management, billing, and system maintenance operations
Different types of admin accounts define different access levels.
Support different types of phones that conform to the specifications.
System must provide uninterrupted voice service during a call.
System must not introduce delays or distortions to the voice data.
The VoIP phones should function exactly like traditional phones.
The admin console must have an intuitive GUI.
